column4: I'm having major apt problems with my kernel/modules: http://pastebin.ca/1795980 I'm scared to reboot. Can someone help me resolve this? Thanks!
never mind, it looks like I need to do a dist-upgrade
not htat big of a deal. you're using a backport for your alsa sound and it was compiled against the older kernel
actually it looks like alsa backport got installed but the kernel that it was based on didnt
MBP 5.x?
hehe, yes.
how'd ya know
me too - are you trying to dist-upgrade to 9.10?
no, but I just installed 9.10 and I'm trying to fix the audio
where did you get the backport alsa?
use the ppa mactel repo
I have it added already
oh, do they have it patched in the ppa repo?
i just did a rebuild of my mbp today and that's the repo i have listed and my alsa is working
though, my kernel is 2.6.31-19-generic x86_64
have you rebooted into the new kernel?
no
do it, your old one is still there
do a uname -r and tell me what it reads
ok, so when you reboot you will have 2 choice (at least) you will have 2.6.31-14 and 2.6.31-20
boot into the new one and then try the alsa package again
